definition: to show off one's ability
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)
awn (of cereals)/arista (of grain)/tip (of a blade)/Miscanthus sinensis (type of grass)/variant of 邙, Mt Mang at Luoyang in Henan
surname Bi
the whole of/to finish/to complete/complete/full/finished
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: Hard-edged body can use to describe the ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: 鋒芒畢露的身體可以用來描述狂喜。

sentences.english: William worked in his father's shop until his talent for drawing became so obvious.
sentences.chinese: 威廉在父親的小店幫忙直到他的繪畫才能鋒芒畢露。

sentences.english: You're clutching a light spear with a sharp, pointed stone at the end of it.
sentences.chinese: 你握緊手中輕盈的長矛，尖端上石制的矛尖鋒芒畢露。

sentences.english: But he was also a hard-edged office politician.
sentences.chinese: 不過，他也是一位鋒芒畢露的辦公室政治家。

sentences.english: Sending a thank you note is an important way of standing out.
sentences.chinese: 發一個感謝的字條是鋒芒畢露的重要格式。

definition: to persist in one's views
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
agility
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
quick-witted/agile of mind
depressed/cheerless
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
sequel/continuation of a book
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
your precious daughter
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
mouth like a torrent (idiom)/eloquent/glib/voluble/have the gift of the gab
